test1.ptxt: Check and repair according to DTC diag. flow.

testgroup.title: Body electrical control system symptom diagnosis

test1.ptxt: Perform check and repair referring to “Symptom Diagnosis” of system having a trouble.

testgroup.question: Is there faulty condition?

test1.ptxt: Clear DTC referring to DTC Clearance .
Check DTC referring to DTC Check .

servinfosub.title: Customer Complaint Analysis
servinfosub.ptxt: Record details of the problem (failure, complaint) and how it occurred as described by the customer.
For this purpose, use of such a questionnaire form as shown in the figure will facilitate collecting information to the point required for proper analysis and diagnosis.

servinfosub.title: Problem Symptom Confirmation
servinfosub.ptxt: Check if what the customer claimed in “Customer Questionnaire” is accurately found in the vehicle. If that symptom is found, check whether the symptom is identified as a failure. (This step should be shared with the customer if possible.)

servinfosub.title: DTC check
servinfosub.ptxt: Check DTC stored in BCM memory referring to DTC Check , record it and then clear it referring to DTC Clearance . DTC indicates malfunction that occurred in the system but does not indicate whether it exists now or it occurred in the past and the normal condition has been restored now. To check which case applies, clear DTC once and check whether or not any fault exists.

servinfosub.title: Troubleshooting for DTC
servinfosub.ptxt: Based on the DTC indicated in Step 3 and referring to applicable DTC flow, locate the cause of the trouble, namely in a sensor, wire harness, connector, BCM or other part and repair or replace faulty parts.

servinfosub.title: Body Electrical Control System Symptom Diagnosis
servinfosub.ptxt: Check the parts or system suspected as a possible cause referring to symptom diagnosis of each system.

servinfosub.title: Check for Intermittent Problem
servinfosub.ptxt: Check parts where an intermittent trouble is easy to occur (e.g., wire harness, connector, etc.), referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection .

servinfosub.title: Final Confirmation Test
servinfosub.ptxt: Confirm that the problem symptom has gone and the body electrical control system is free from any abnormal conditions. If what has been repaired is related to the malfunction DTC, check DTC again and confirm that no DTC is indicated.
